		Question: who was saint paul the apostle
		Answer:
answer:
Sure, here is the answer:

The answer to the question "Who was Saint Paul the Apostle" is that he was the Apostle Paul, also known as Paul the Apostle, Saul of Tarsus, and Paul of Tarsus. He was born in Tarsus in Cilicia (modern-day Turkey), and was a Roman citizen. He was a Pharisee, but was converted to Christianity by Jesus on the road to Damascus. He became a missionary, and wrote letters to the early Christian churches
